required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study of Exploring Camrelizumab in the Treatment of Colorectal Mucinous Adenocarcinoma(MAC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study of Exploring Camrelizumab in the Treatment of Colorectal Mucinous Adenocarcinoma(MAC)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single center, non-randomized, phase Ⅱ trial to evaluate safety and efficacy of using the combination treatment of Camrelizumab with anti-angiogenic drugs and Chemotherapy of metastatic colorectal mucinous adenocarcinoma(MAC).

detailed_description.textblock: Colorectal cancer contains multiple pathological types, and one of the more special pathological types is mucinous adenocarcinoma. The prognosis of patients with mucinous adenocarcinoma is not ideal.Some molecular and genetic factors may be related to the characteristics of mucinous adenocarcinoma, in which microsatellite instability and loss of mismatch repair proteins are a focus of current research. Microsatellite instability is often associated with poor differentiation and higher tumor stage. Adenocarcinoma that secretes a large amount of mucus in pathological features.so,In this study, the incidence of ORR and AEs was the main endpoint, and the efficacy and safety of Camrelizumab combined with anti-angiogenic drugs in the treatment of advanced colorectal mucinous adenocarcinoma were observed and evaluated.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate evaluated by Independent Review Committee using radiographic examination according to RECIST1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: partial rate of subjects evaluated as CR/PR/SD in all subjects

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: time from randomization to progression and death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year

arm_group.description: Camrelizumab:200mg,iv,Q2W; Fruquintinib:5mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;or Regorafenib: 80mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;or Apatinib:250mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;

Camrelizumab:200mg,iv,Q3W; Irinotecan:150mg/m2,iv 30~90min,d1,Q3W Fruquintinib:5mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;or Regorafenib: 80mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;or Apatinib:250mg,po.qd,Day1~21, repeat every 28 days;

intervention.intervention_name: Carilizumab + anti-angiogenic TKIs (available with fuquitinib, rigofenib, apatinib, etc.)
intervention.description: Observe the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors combined with anti-angiogenic drugs for colorectal mucinous adenocarcinoma

intervention.intervention_name: Carilizumab + anti-angiogenic TKIs (available with fuquitinib, rigofenib, apatinib, etc.)+Irinotecan
intervention.description: Observe the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors combined with anti-angiogenic drugs and chemotherapy for colorectal mucinous adenocarcinoma
